body_content.explanation: a very long set of walls and towers in northern China that were built as a defence against attack from the north, mainly between the 14th and 17th centuries. It is now a UNESCO World Heritage Site:
examples: So now the East Devon and Dorset Coast ranks alongside the Grand Canyon, the Great Barrier Reef, the Taj Mahal, and the Great Wall of China.
Abramović and her partner Ulay had set off from opposite ends of the Great Wall of China and passed each other in the middle.
